gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat

Class StandoffAnnotationEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.StandoffAnnotationEvaluator

  • public class StandoffAnnotationEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    The class to compare/evaluate a directory of standoff annotation files against another directory of such files.

    In the case of evaluation, the second directory is expected to contain the gold files.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • printResults

        public static void printResults(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> typeMap,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoTP,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFP,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFN)
        Writes comparison results to a file or stream, reports Precision, Recall, and F1 measures at the semantic type, annotation type, and global levels.
        Parameters:
        pw - the writer to print the results to
        typeMap - annotation type/semantic type map for which comparison will be performed.
        annoTP - true positives
        annoFP - false positives
        annoFN - false negatives

      • printDiffs

        public static void printDiffs(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> typeMap,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFP,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoFN)
        Writes differences to a file or stream.
        Parameters:
        pw - the writer to print the errors to
        typeMap - annotation type/semantic type map for which comparison will be performed.
        annoFP - differences of the first annotation set from the second (or false positives)
        annoFN - differences of the second set from the first (or false negatives)

      • printCorrect

        public static void printCorrect(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> typeMap,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Annotation>> annoTP)
        Writes true positive annotations to a file or stream.
        Parameters:
        pw - the writer to print the errors to
        typeMap - annotation type/semantic type map for which comparison will be performed.
        annoTP - matches between the output and the gold standard
